data: On the 2nd of February, 1873, the “Pilgrim,” a tight little craft of 400 tons burden, lay in lat. 43° 57', S. and long. 165° 19', W.
On the 2nd of February, 1873, the "Pilgrim," a tight little craft of 400 tons burden, lay in lat. 43° 57', S. and long. 165° 19', W.
Verne, Jules, 1828-1905; Frewer, Ellen E. (Ellen Elizabeth), 1848-1940 [Translator]
